meanings.definition: The moist tissue lining certain organs and body cavities, such as the nose and mouth.
meanings.sent1: The mucosas in the nose help trap dust particles.
meanings.sent2: Doctors examine the mucosas in the mouth during a check-up.
meanings.sent3: The sneezing cat blamed its runny nose on its overactive mucosas.
meanings.sent4: Her words clung to his mind like sticky mucosas, impossible to shake off.
meanings.sent5: The slimy mucosas in the throat made swallowing difficult.

meanings.definition: The mucous membrane that lines the respiratory and digestive tracts.
meanings.sent1: A healthy diet supports the mucosas in the digestive tract.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how smoking can harm the mucosas in the respiratory system.
meanings.sent3: The ticklish sensation in his stomach was blamed on mischievous mucosas.
meanings.sent4: Her voice wrapped around him like a warm blanket, comforting his raw mucosas.
meanings.sent5: The mucosas in the lungs act as a protective barrier against harmful particles.
